content: May 3 (Reuters) - Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc said on Wednesday it expects a $31 million hit to full-year profit from disruptions and rework related to affected 737 MAX fuselages.

"Additional costs are expected, including costs Boeing may assert to repair certain models of previously delivered units in their factory and warranty costs related to affected 737 units in service," Spirit added.Boeing last month said it had paused deliveries of some 737 MAXs due to a problem involving two fittings that join the aft fuselage made by Spirit AeroSystems to the vertical tail, which were not attached correctly. (Reporting by Abhijith Ganapavaram in Bengaluru and Valerie Insinna in Washington; Editing by Sriraj Kalluvila)
